subsection_content:
Ankle synovitis is divided into two main types: acute and chronic. Each condition will have different symptoms, specifically:
1. Acute
The condition often results from injury, infection or joint disease. Common symptoms include:
Pain when palpated.; Joint range of motion is narrowed.; The patient feels severe pain when moving; The pain becomes severe when performing contractions or extensions due to compression of the muscles.; In case of bursitis due to infection, the skin temperature will increase, which can differ from the initial temperature level by about 2.2 degrees.
2. Chronic
Chronic bursitis often occurs due to repeated injuries or excessive pressure on the joint. This condition is usually not painful. However, over time, the increased amount of fluid will lead to swelling.
In general, most patients with ankle bursitis notice the following common symptoms:
Pain in the back of the ankle; Limp.; The range of motion of the ankle is limited.; The ankles are tight; The skin of the ankle is swollen, red and hot; Find it difficult to perform weight-bearing activities such as running, standing, etc.
